src:
Excarcelan a “Vitito” y fijan duras reglas de conducta, bien lejos de su ex pareja
El individuo también habría viralizado videos íntimos de su ex.
06 Nov 2019 by Policiales
La jueza de Género, Norma Morán, excarceló ayer a un individuo acusado de amenazar a la ex con viralizar videos hot.
Apodado “Vitito”, fue apresado 19 días atrás, previa denuncia de las abogadas Karina Ibáñez y Florencia Ingratta.
De acuerdo con la denuncia, “Vitito” habría amenazado a la ex pareja con viralizar fotos y videos y hasta advertido que perdería su trabajo.
La causa cayó en órbitas de la fiscal Andrea Juárez, quien lo indagó, pero “Vitito” prefirió el silencio total.
La suerte del hombre se definió entre el lunes y martes en audiencia. A su turno, el abogado defensor, Gilberto Perduca, abogó por libertad, dado a la carencia de antecedentes.
Después de escuchar a las partes, la magistrada ayer dio luz verde a la libertad de “Vitito”, previo fijarle restricciones e impedimento de contacto absolutos.
text:
They release “Vitito” and set hard rules of conduct, well away from their former partner
The individual would also have viralized intimate videos of his ex.
06 Nov 2019 by Policiales
Gender judge Norma Morán yesterday released an individual accused of threatening the former with viralizing hot videos.
Nicknamed "Vitito", he was arrested 19 days ago, after denouncing the lawyers Karina Ibáñez and Florencia Ingratta.
According to the complaint, "Vitito" would have threatened the former couple with viralizing photos and videos and even warned that he would lose his job.
The cause fell into orbits of the prosecutor Andrea Juárez, who investigated it, but "Vitito" preferred total silence.
The fate of man was defined between Monday and Tuesday in audience. In turn, the defense lawyer, Gilberto Perduca, advocated freedom, given the lack of background.
After listening to the parties, the magistrate yesterday gave the green light to the freedom of "Vitito", prior to setting absolute restrictions and impediment of contact.
